I would have seized <lb n="c57-0108_main_5"/>him but he eluded me and quitting the house <lb n="c57-0108_main_6"/>with precipitation in a few moments I saw him <lb n="c57-0108_main_7"/>in his boat which shot across the waters with <lb n="c57-0108_main_8"/>an arrowy swiftness & was soon lost amidst the <lb n="c57-0108_main_9"/>waves.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0108_main_10"/>All was again silent; but his words rung in <lb n="c57-0108_main_11"/>my ears; I burnt with rage to pursue the <lb n="c57-0108_main_12"/>murderer of my peace & precipitate him into <lb n="c57-0108_main_13"/>the ocean. I walked up & down my room hastily <lb n="c57-0108_main_14"/>& perturbed, my imagination conjured before <lb n="c57-0108_main_15"/>me a thousand images <del rend="strikethrough">all</del> to torment & sting <lb n="c57-0108_main_16"/>me – Why <del rend="strikethrough">d</del> had I not followed him & closed with <lb n="c57-0108_main_17"/>him in<del rend="strikethrough">t</del> mortal strife–<add place="superlinear">?</add> But I had suffered <lb n="c57-0108_main_18"/>him to depart and he had directed his course <lb n="c57-0108_main_19"/>towards the main land; I shuddered to sup<lb n="c57-0108_main_20"/>pose who might be the next victim sacri<lb n="c57-0108_main_21"/>ficed to his insatiate revenge – And then <lb n="c57-0108_main_22"/>again I thought of his words – "<hi rend="underline">I will be with</hi><lb n="c57-0108_main_23"/><hi rend="underline">you on your marriage night</hi> That then <lb n="c57-0108_main_24"/>was the period fixed for the fulfillment <lb n="c57-0108_main_25"/>of my destiny – <add place="intralinear">I</add>n that <add place="sublinear"><metamark function="insert">^</metamark></add><add place="superlinear">hour</add> I should die and at <lb n="c57-0108_main_26"/>once satisfy and extinguish his malic<retrace cause="unclear">e</retrace>. <delSpan rend="strikethrough" spanTo="#c57-0108.01"/>Yet <lb n="c57-0108_main_27"/>when I thought of Elizabeth<anchor xml:id="c57-0108.01"/>

</graphic><zone type="main" xmlns:mith="http://mith.umd.edu/sc/ns1#"><lb n="c57-0115_main_1"/>you will not be consulted as to your <lb n="c57-0115_main_2"/>quarters, I promise you—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0115_main_3"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough">My</del> I was exceedingly surprized at receiv<lb n="c57-0115_main_4"/>ing so rude an answer from a stranger <lb n="c57-0115_main_5"/>and I was also disconcerted on perceiving th<add place="intralinear">e</add><lb n="c57-0115_main_6"/><delSpan rend="strikethrough" spanTo="#c57-0115.01"/>the countenance of this man an his <lb n="c57-0115_main_7"/>companions<anchor xml:id="c57-0115.01"/> frow<add><metamark function="insert">^</metamark></add><add place="superlinear">n</add>ing and angry countenances <lb n="c57-0115_main_8"/>of his companions – <del rend="strikethrough">Why</del> Why do you answer <lb n="c57-0115_main_9"/>me so roughly, I replied Surely <del rend="strikethrough">as En</del> it <lb n="c57-0115_main_10"/>is not the custom of Englishmen to receive <lb n="c57-0115_main_11"/>strangers <del rend="strikethrough"><add place="superlinear">in</add></del> so inhospitably.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0115_main_12"/>I do not know, said the man, what <lb n="c57-0115_main_13"/>the custom of the English may be but <lb n="c57-0115_main_14"/>it is the custom of the Irish to hate <lb n="c57-0115_main_15"/>villains. <milestone unit="tei:p"/><add place="intralinear"><metamark function="paragraph">[</metamark></add>While this strange dialogue <lb n="c57-0115_main_16"/>continued I perceived the croud <del rend="strikethrough">en</del> rapidly <lb n="c57-0115_main_17"/>encrease.
